physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ms. M was euthymic and taking 400 mg/day of clozapine, 900 mg/day of lithium, and 75 mg/day of lamotrigine; she was admitted with psychotic mixed mania.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Ms. Mâ€™s psychiatric condition improved and stabilized over time, though there were instances of increasing depression and suicidal thoughts, particularly when medications were decreased.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 28 weeks, Ms. M developed gestational diabetes and required insulin; at 36.5 weeks, she had premature rupture of membranes and delivered a baby girl by cesarean section with Apgar scores of 7 and 8.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postpartum, Ms. M experienced increasing depression with fleeting suicidal thoughts but was able to bond with her baby over the weeks.
